content.description: Boulder start to relatively easier terrain.    Thin holds lead to the steep roof where some big moves lie.
content.location: Right of the Tomb.

content.description:
It's a little bit dirty, but what do you expect from a trad climb at a backwoods sport crag?

 Start in the fists/off-fists crack 15 feet left of the large corner.  Burl your way through the first 15 feet of 3.5-4 sized crack.  Once established over the roof, pull up into a small corner, and follow the pleasant hand crack up and right to a mossy ledge.  The route crosses a sport climb at this point, and you will pass right by a bolt.  Clip it if your conscience allows it; skip it otherwise.  

 Either way, you're aiming for a right angling hand crack that turns into a horizontal undercling crack.  After the traverse, the route intersects Saddle Up.  Finish by pulling the upper roof of Saddle Up, then running it out to the chains.
content.protection: Singles .3-.5.  Doubles .75-4.  Bring several shoulder length slings.
content.location: Starts 15 feet left of the large corner system at a small roof split by a fist crack.

content.description:
Stellar movements and hard pulls create this magnificent route that rules over the tomb. 

  Begin with some initial terrain and fire a few sequences where a short kneebar rest lets you prepare for the intimidating refrigerator compression crux. 

  Slap your way up the steep block and collect yourself for the tricky finish that lies ahead.  

  All around amazing moves that you'll be hard pressed to find anywhere on a sport route.    Intense bouldering high up in the air! 

  Doesn't get much better than this one.
content.location: To the left of "White Noise"

content.description: Being the easiest line in the Tomb proper, this route will get you warmed up and accustomed to the pump that the rest of the routes in the Tomb are guaranteed to deliver. That being said, this route is no cake walk. Enjoy a technical and unique start followed by about 40 feet of jug bashery.There are a few sections where you may want to tread lightly, the route has been hammered and crowbarred to make safe, but you never know when rock might decide to come off and send you for a ride. Might become a 4 star line if the choss cleans up a bit more.
content.location: Starts on the rock pillar up and right of white noise.

content.description:
Climb through some initial terrain that tends to seasonally seep. Fight through the right facing corner on steep jugs and pull through a cryptic crux on an amazing feature.  

  Follow the route into the finish of "White Noise" (Share same anchors)
content.location: Directly right of the "Undertaker".

content.description: Follow the crack for a few bolts before trending left through edges and good holds. Rest a bit and head straight up towards the steep finish.
content.location: Left side of the Tomb immediately left of Saddle Up.

content.description: Start in the large corner and follow the obvious, varying crack system through two roofs.  After pulling the second roof, run it out 15 feet to the anchors at the base of the large roof that marks the top of the cliff.
content.protection: A single set of cams up to .75, then doubles of 1-4 should allow you to sew it up.  Long runners useful to avoid rope drag.
content.location: Starts 10 fee left of The Ossuary in an obvious corner.

content.description: Crux v7ish boulder off the ground through the first 2 or 3 bolts.  Difficulty eases off significantly after that. Still one 5.11+ crux near the top, ending in a crazy exposed mantel.
content.location: First route right of Rest in Peace.  Left of Purgatory.  Goes up the obvious prow with holds/beta that's not so obvious.

content.description: On the left side of the tomb, start on the high rock stack to a campus start. A technical and cruxy lower half is broken up by good rest to bigger moves on steeper stone up top. Move around the large tombstone and gain ground on-top of it before veering right to the very long chains and biners.
content.protection: 10 draws, fixed lowering biners on very long chains
content.location: 2nd route in The Tomb on the left with an obvious rock stack start veering right.

content.description: This is a variation of RIP and Ossuary. Climb the first 3 bolts and lower crux of RIP. Place a long sling and traverser up and left into the roof bolt of Ossuary. Place another long sling or double draw and climb the mid-5.11 crux of Ossuary. More enjoyable than climbing the Ossuary and slightly more difficult than RIP.
content.location: Starts on RIP and link's into the great upper headwall of Ossuary. Use long slings or double draws to the bolts of the link-up.

content.description:
Start the same as "Dusk Till Dawn", after the sit down rest in the route trend right into a dihedral after the fixed bolt on the wall.  

  From here continue straight up on awesome balancy moves, to a photo finish dyno out the epicenter of the Tomb's roof.
content.protection: 9 bolts, Fixed carabiners on chains for anchors
content.location: Middle of Tomb, same start as "Dusk Till Dawn"

content.description: One of the tombs more obscure lines. Starts to the right of "White Noise" and has an awkward shallow fingerlock/pinch crux down low after a good hold outside the fingerlock broke before the FA. Difficulty backs off significantly after pulling this crux and climbs a large crack/flake system up and right to independent anchors.
content.location: Right of "White Noise" and Left of "Evil Dead"

content.description: Pull a technical and powerful 12- crux sequence into flowly big moves to a no-hands stance. Contemplate your existence...or the powerful compression crux that some feel may be more difficult than Undertakers. Put a long sling on the first bolt of the roof and preclip this before entering into the compression crux. Stays with you once you leave the Purgatory stance all the way to the anchors.
content.protection: Bolts and 2 Anchors.  The route has permas beyond the ledge rest to the anchors.
content.location: Start on the vertical face to the right of Rigor Mortis.

content.description:
Superb moves on this climb make up for the poor quality rock down low.  

  Climb easy terrain to a jump dyno, take a break with a sit down rest then fire up to some of the best moves in the tomb.  

It is common for the holds on both cruxes to be damp or wet. Down low they tend to seep, and up high it generally holds moisture for a long period of time.
content.location: To the left of "Dusk Till Dawn"

content.description: Somewhere in the 11+/12- range. Get your western slab crimp game on for the very thin and balancey crux down low and then transition in a 3-4' roof pulling a 5.11 redpoint crux and then awesome big pulls between good holds to the same anchors as Saddle Up
content.location: Starts 10' left of RIP and 10' right of the dihedral start of Saddle Up.

content.description: Begin in the dihedral left of Cartouche. Climb straight up to a no-hands ledge, clip the long chain in the roof (may seem a bit run out here, but the chain can be clipped from a no-hands stance, just be careful), and get horizontal through the roof. Keep it together because the hardest moves await you after you've clipped the last bolt.
content.location: In between Death by 1000 Jugs and Cartouche.

content.description: This is a phenomenal route that stays on you from the 2nd bolt to the anchors. The lower crux is almost always wet and all ascensionists have had to manage with the wet crimp. Don't let 1 constantly wet hold keep you from experiencing this amazing powerfest. The upper technical balance stemming crux seems improbable until you figure it out and then it's maybe only a mid-5.11 crux and some of the coolest postitioning and exposure in the Tomb. Getchya Some and Get On It!
content.location: Route is to climber's right of Pushing Up Daisies and to the left of Third Day.

content.description:
Low boulder problem to a break in the rock above. Sit down rest, then fire up the steep head wall to a dynamic jug to jug throw. From here keep it together to a small roof finish. 

  Amazing Climb.
content.protection: 9 bolts, 1 fixed. Fixed carbiners on long chains for anchors
content.location: In the middle of the tomb. Same start as "Resident Evil"

content.description: This is a linkup of Rest in Peace and Rigor Mortis.  Climb through the first 6 bolts of Rest in Peace, clipping a runner on the 6th bolt (small roof).  When you get to the rest near the 7th bolt, instead go right and clip the Rigor Mortis bolt around the corner about waist high.  Continue up Rigor Mortis for a second 5.11+ crux, ending in a wild exposed mantel.  Easy ground to the finish from here.
content.location: Start on Rest in Peace, finish on Rigor Mortis.  Left side of the tomb up obvious prow

content.description:
Stick clip the long chain in the roof.  Easy start up to the roof. Work out the roof pull the crux onto the face. Catch a rest to enjoy bucket jugs to the chains. 

 Short Warm up!!
content.location: The Right side of the Tomb

content.description:
Begin this route completely around the corner left of the bolt line. Highstep onto the slabby face and smear across to gain the juggy arete and a stance. Peek around the corner to clip the first bolt. From here climb the face just to the right of the arete. Move through a roof (crux) and finish on easy jugs.

 Established more for a warmup, take a few laps and please only use the anchor biners for cleaning.
content.location: This is the left most route on the wall near an arete and has black hangars.

content.description: Climbs the first half of Undertaker (5 bolts), then finishes on Tales From the Crypt, skipping the lower no hands rest of Tales. Clip the 5th bolt of Tales instead of Undertaker to reduce rope drag at the top of the arete crux. Step right in the upper dihedral transition into TFTC and finish same as TFTC/WN avoiding the kneebar rest over on White Noise. This is sort of an eliminate but the goal of this route is a fitness link-up that stay dry and avoids as many of the rests/breaks as possible while taking a massive steep arching path out the Tomb while linking multiple cruxes. Another advantage to this line is it stays dryer significantly more often than the typical wet and manky start of TFTC
content.location: Starts on Undertaker, which is located in between Resident Evil and Tales From the Crypt.

content.description: Traverse up and right to the first bolt where technical face climbing leads you past 6 bolts to a great rest just below the steep finish. Save some juice for the crux anchor clip.
content.protection: 8 quickdraws. The route currently has fixed biners at the top.
content.location: Furthest route right of the tombs. Left of the waterfall. Starts on the obvious chalked up jug way to the left.

content.description: Start as for "undertaker" and before the compression crux bust left to link into the finish of "Resident Evil"
content.location: Start as for "Undertaker"

content.description:
The premiere wall of Rock Creek. Tall, steep, grand and burly! 

  This 80ft wall features some of the best hard climbing in the state and lends itself to routes with many places for climbers to use their arsenal of tricks and tactics to climb these routes.  

  Aesthetically this wall offers great scenery surrounding it as a seasonal waterfall runs to add a great auditory ambiance, as well as large birch trees that guard the tomb and give the climber a small sense of being.
